parameters.name: acl_p
parameters.description:
The address of a pointer to the ACL that you want to add an entry to.
  If acl_create_entry() needs to reallocate the entry, it updates this
  argument.

parameters.name: entry_p
parameters.description: A pointer to a location where the function can store a pointer to the new entry.

full_content:
Function: acl_create_entry
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/acl_create_entry.html
Synopsis: int acl_create_entry( acl_t *acl_p,
Headers: #include <sys/acl.h>
Parameters:
  - acl_p: The address of a pointer to the ACL that you want to add an entry to.
  If acl_create_entry() needs to reallocate the entry, it updates this
  argument.
  - entry_p: A pointer to a location where the function can store a pointer to the new entry.
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <sys/acl.h>

int acl_create_entry( acl_t *acl_p,
                      acl_entry_t *entry_p );
